title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0263

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we're talking about where people come from or nationalities.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论人们来自哪里或国籍。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Many people come from many different countries, just like our listeners.
segments.cn: 很多人来自不同的国家，就像我们的听众一样。

segments.en: And there are specific words or adjectives and nouns to describe people.
segments.cn: 有特定的词或形容词和名词来描述人。

segments.en: Like, for example, somebody who is from China.
segments.cn: 比如，来自中国的人。

segments.en: A Chinese person.
segments.cn: 一个中国人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, in your case, Marco, you are an Ecuadorian.
segments.cn: 所以，在你这个例子中，Marco，你是厄瓜多尔人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, that means I come from the country Ecuador.
segments.cn: 这意味着我来自厄瓜多尔。

segments.en: I, on the other hand, am an American.
segments.cn: 而我则是美国人。

segments.en: I come from America.
segments.cn: 我来自美国。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, we have a lot of these examples.
segments.cn: 所以，我们有很多这样的例子。

segments.en: Why don't we jump into the dialogue.
segments.cn: 为什么我们不直接进入对话呢。

segments.en: Let's see where all of the people from this international class are from.
segments.cn: 让我们看看这个国际班的所有人来自哪里。

segments.en: And we'll be back to talk about it.
segments.cn: 我们会回来讨论这个。

segments.en: Hey, how was your first day of class?
segments.cn: 嘿，你的第一天上课怎么样？

segments.en: I'm a level 2 and I'm loving my class this semester.
segments.cn: 我是二级，我这个学期很喜欢我的课。

segments.en: It's great being in a class of international students.
segments.cn: 在国际学生的班级里真不错。

segments.en: Mine was okay, except that no one in my class speaks English.
segments.cn: 我还好，只是我班上没有人说英语。

segments.en: I guess it will force me to converse in Chinese more in class, so at least I should improve a lot this semester.
segments.cn: 我想这会迫使我在课堂上更多地用中文交流，所以至少我这个学期应该会有很大进步。

segments.en: That's both fortunate and unfortunate.
segments.cn: 这既是幸运也是不幸。

segments.en: It's the United Nations in my class.
segments.cn: 我班上就像联合国。

segments.en: We have people from all over the world.
segments.cn: 我们有来自世界各地的人。

segments.en: There are three Germans, a Pole, a Scott, two French, an American, a Brazilian, a Chilean, a New Zealander, though he prefers to call himself a Kiwi.
segments.cn: 有三个德国人，一个波兰人，一个苏格兰人，两个法国人，一个美国人，一个巴西人，一个智利人，一个新西兰人，尽管他更喜欢称自己为Kiwi。

segments.en: Who else do we have?
segments.cn: 还有谁呢？

segments.en: Oh, we have a Moroccan, a Tagolese, a Pakistani, and two Indonesians.
segments.cn: 哦，我们有一个摩洛哥人，一个塔戈洛人，一个巴基斯坦人和两个印尼人。

segments.en: That's quite the array of nationalities.
segments.cn: 这真是一个多样的国籍。

segments.en: Everyone in my class is from Asia, except me.
segments.cn: 我班上的每个人都来自亚洲，除了我。

segments.en: There are a few South Koreans, several Japanese, Malaysian, Thai, Singaporean, Filipino, Kazakhstani, and one Russian.
segments.cn: 有几个韩国人，几个日本人，马来西亚人，泰国人，新加坡人，菲律宾人，哈萨克斯坦人，还有一个俄罗斯人。

segments.en: Well, I think you're pretty lucky, actually.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得你其实很幸运。

segments.en: You'll have the opportunity to learn so much about Asian culture.
segments.cn: 你将有机会了解很多亚洲文化。

segments.en: I guess so, but I think it's going to be hard to relate to my classmates, especially with the language barrier.
segments.cn: 我想是的，但我觉得与同学交流会很困难，尤其是语言障碍。

segments.en: I think I might change classes.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会换班。

segments.en: Don't!
segments.cn: 不要！

segments.en: Stay the course!
segments.cn: 坚持下去！

segments.en: Your spoken Chinese will be eternally grateful.
segments.cn: 你的口语中文会永远感激你。

segments.en: I bet you it will even surpass mine with all that practice.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌，经过这么多练习，你的中文甚至会超过我的。

segments.en: I highly doubt it.
segments.cn: 我对此表示怀疑。

segments.en: Your girlfriend is Chinese.
segments.cn: 你的女朋友是中国人。

segments.en: Well, there is that, yes.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，确实如此。

segments.en: So, the student jokes that their class is kind of like the United Nations.
segments.cn: 所以，学生开玩笑说他们的班级有点像联合国。

segments.en: So, it does sound like it.
segments.cn: 听起来确实如此。

segments.en: We have so many different nationalities that we're going to look at them in two groups today.
segments.cn: 我们有这么多不同的国籍，今天我们将把它们分成两组来看。

segments.en: But the United Nations, as you know, is a political group that has people from all over the world who make decisions about politics and the environment, things like that.
segments.cn: 但联合国，正如你所知，是一个政治团体，来自世界各地的人们在这里做出关于政治和环境等方面的决策。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at these nationalities now on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在为什么不看看这些国籍呢，在Language Takeaway上。

segments.en: The first few are from Europe, so these are some European nationalities.
segments.cn: 前几个来自欧洲，所以这些是一些欧洲国籍。

segments.en: We've got German.
segments.cn: 我们有德国人。

segments.en: Where is a German from?
segments.cn: 德国人来自哪里？

segments.en: A German is from Germany.
segments.cn: 德国人来自德国。

segments.en: Okay, so next to Germany, we have another country, Poland.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来是另一个国家，波兰。

segments.en: What do we call a person from Poland?
segments.cn: 我们称来自波兰的人为波兰人。

segments.en: You call that person a pole.
segments.cn: 这个词是男女通用的吗，还是只针对一个性别？

segments.en: So, is this for a woman and a man, or is this just one gender?
segments.cn: 是的，适用于两者。

segments.en: Yeah, it's for both.
segments.cn: 好的，所以波兰人。

segments.en: Okay, so pole.
segments.cn: 是的，女孩。

segments.en: Yeah, a girl.
segments.cn: 来自波兰的女孩也是波兰人。

segments.en: A girl that's from Poland would be also a pole.
segments.cn: 现在，来自苏格兰的人，另一方面……那就是苏格兰人。

segments.en: Now, someone that comes from Scotland, on the other hand... That would be a Scott.
segments.cn: 如果是男人，就是苏格兰人。

segments.en: Or if it's a man, a Scotsman.
segments.cn: 苏格兰人，好的。

segments.en: Scotsman, okay.
segments.cn: 现在，这很有趣，因为我们提到了这些国籍的名词，比如，德国人。

segments.en: Now, this is interesting because we are mentioning the nouns of these nationalities, like, for example, German.
segments.cn: 现在，当我们看波兰的波兰人时，形容词是什么？

segments.en: Now, when we took a look at pole from Poland, what would be the adjective?
segments.cn: 我说，我是波兰人吗？

segments.en: Do I say, I am pole?
segments.cn: 我是波兰的。

segments.en: I am Polish.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 或者，如果你想用名词，我是一个波兰人。

segments.en: Or, if you want to use the noun, I am a pole.
segments.cn: 但形容词也可以用于事物。

segments.en: But the adjective can be used for things as well.
segments.cn: 我喜欢吃波兰香肠。

segments.en: I love to eat Polish sausages.
segments.cn: 好的，或者，例如，来自苏格兰的东西，你可以说，我喜欢苏格兰威士忌。

segments.en: Okay, or, for example, something from Scotland, you can say, I love Scottish whiskey.
segments.cn: 或者，我喜欢苏格兰裙子。

segments.en: Or, I love Scottish kilts.
segments.cn: 那些裙子。

segments.en: Those skirts.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是形容词。

segments.en: Alright, so that's the adjective.
segments.cn: 但在法国，法国这个国家，我们必须说，作为名词，他是一个法国人。

segments.en: Okay, and if it's a woman, a French woman.
segments.cn: 好的，如果是女人，就是法国女人。

segments.en: That's right, or in the case of an adjective, I love to eat French bread.
segments.cn: 没错，或者在形容词的情况下，我喜欢吃法式面包。

segments.en: Okay, now moving on to South America, we took a look at a Brazilian and a Chilean.
segments.cn: 好的，现在转到南美，我们看到了巴西人和智利人。

segments.en: Okay, so Brazil, Brazilian.
segments.cn: 好的，所以巴西，巴西人。

segments.en: In this country, there are many Brazilians.
segments.cn: 在这个国家，有很多巴西人。

segments.en: And Chile, or Chile, as many Americans say, has people called Chileans.
segments.cn: 而智利，或者智利，正如许多美国人所说，有人称为智利人。

segments.en: Some people say Chilean.
segments.cn: 有些人说智利人。

segments.en: So, I don't know, I guess the accent varies a little bit.
segments.cn: 所以，我不知道，我想口音有点不同。

segments.en: Now, why don't we move back to the other side of the world.
segments.cn: 现在，为什么我们不回到世界的另一边。

segments.en: We have a New Zealander.
segments.cn: 我们有一个新西兰人。

segments.en: Alright, so many of you have heard of Australia.
segments.cn: 好吧，很多人听说过澳大利亚。

segments.en: Maybe New Zealand is not as famous.
segments.cn: 也许新西兰没有那么出名。

segments.en: It's a small country near Australia.
segments.cn: 这是一个靠近澳大利亚的小国。

segments.en: And the people who come from there are called New Zealanders.
segments.cn: 来自那里的人被称为新西兰人。

segments.en: It's very hard to say those sometimes, especially when we have to use the adjective New Zealand.
segments.cn: 有时说这些很难，尤其是当我们必须使用形容词新西兰时。

segments.en: That's right, so the student said he prefers to call himself a Kiwi.
segments.cn: 没错，所以学生说他更喜欢称自己为Kiwi。

segments.en: Alright, so Kiwi was a special kind of bird that could only be found in New Zealand.
segments.cn: 好吧，Kiwi是一种只能在新西兰找到的特殊鸟。

segments.en: And so this became a very popular symbol for New Zealand.
segments.cn: 所以这成为了新西兰的一个非常受欢迎的象征。

segments.en: And now people from New Zealand call themselves Kiwis.
segments.cn: 现在来自新西兰的人称自己为Kiwis。

segments.en: So I could say, I have many Kiwi friends.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，我有很多Kiwi朋友。

segments.en: That's right, okay.
segments.cn: 没错，好的。

segments.en: Kiwis.
segments.cn: 奇异鸟。

segments.en: So now if we go to the African continent, we have Moroccan and Togolese.
segments.cn: 现在如果我们去非洲大陆，我们有摩洛哥人和多哥人。

segments.en: So Morocco is in North Africa and a person who comes from there is Moroccan.
segments.cn: 摩洛哥在北非，来自那里的人是摩洛哥人。

segments.en: You can also say, I like to eat Moroccan food, which is very popular.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，我喜欢吃摩洛哥菜，这非常受欢迎。

segments.en: But when we talk about the country Togo, what do we call a person from that country?
segments.cn: 但当我们谈到多哥这个国家时，我们称来自那个国家的人为？

segments.en: Togolese.
segments.cn: 多哥人。

segments.en: Togolese.
segments.cn: 多哥人。

segments.en: Okay, so it's Togo, that's the way you pronounce it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以是多哥，这就是你的发音方式。

segments.en: Because if you look at it, I would say Togo.
segments.cn: 因为如果你看它，我会说多哥。

segments.en: Right, but it's not Togo, it's Togo.
segments.cn: 对，但不是多哥，是多哥。

segments.en: Or as my French speaking friends would say, Togo.
segments.cn: 或者像我的法语朋友会说，多哥。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, so that's our first set of nationalities.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们第一组国籍。

segments.en: Let's listen to today's dialogue one more time.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍今天的对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back in a moment to discuss the other nationalities.
segments.cn: 我们稍后会回来讨论其他国籍。

segments.en: Hey, how was your first day of class?
segments.cn: 嘿，你的第一天上课怎么样？

segments.en: I'm a level 2 and I'm loving my class this semester.
segments.cn: 我是二级学生，这学期我很喜欢我的课。

segments.en: It's great being in a class of international students.
segments.cn: 在国际学生的班级里真不错。

segments.en: Mine was okay.
segments.cn: 我还好。

segments.en: Except that no one in my class speaks English.
segments.cn: 除了我班上没有人说英语。

segments.en: I guess it will force me to converse in Chinese more in class.
segments.cn: 我想这会迫使我在课堂上更多地用中文交流。

segments.en: So at least I should improve a lot this semester.
segments.cn: 所以至少这学期我应该会有很大进步。

segments.en: That's both fortunate and unfortunate.
segments.cn: 这既是幸运也是不幸。

segments.en: It's the United Nations in my class.
segments.cn: 我班上就像联合国一样。

segments.en: We have people from all over the world.
segments.cn: 我们有来自世界各地的人。

segments.en: There are three Germans, a Pole, a Scott, two French, an American, a Brazilian, a Chilean, a New Zealander, though he prefers to call himself a Kiwi.
segments.cn: 有三个德国人，一个波兰人，一个苏格兰人，两位法国人，一个美国人，一个巴西人，一个智利人，一个新西兰人，尽管他更喜欢称自己为奇异鸟。

segments.en: Who else do we have?
segments.cn: 还有谁呢？

segments.en: Oh, we have a Moroccan, a Tagolese, a Pakistani, and two Indonesians.
segments.cn: 哦，我们有一个摩洛哥人，一个多哥人，一个巴基斯坦人和两个印尼人。

segments.en: That's quite the array of nationalities.
segments.cn: 这真是一个多样的国籍阵容。

segments.en: Everyone in my class is from Asia, except me.
segments.cn: 我班上的每个人都来自亚洲，除了我。

segments.en: There are a few South Koreans, several Japanese, Malaysian, Thai, Singaporean, Filipino, Kazakhstani, and one Russian.
segments.cn: 有几个韩国人，几个日本人，马来西亚人，泰国人，新加坡人，菲律宾人，哈萨克斯坦人，还有一个俄罗斯人。

segments.en: Well, I think you're pretty lucky, actually.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得你其实很幸运。

segments.en: You'll have the opportunity to learn so much about Asian culture.
segments.cn: 你将有机会了解很多亚洲文化。

segments.en: I guess so.
segments.cn: 我想是的。

segments.en: But I think it's going to be hard to relate to my classmates, especially with the language barrier.
segments.cn: 但我觉得与我的同学交流会很困难，尤其是语言障碍。

segments.en: I think I might change classes.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会换班。

segments.en: Don't!
segments.cn: 不要！

segments.en: Stay the course!
segments.cn: 坚持下去！

segments.en: Your spoken Chinese will be eternally grateful.
segments.cn: 你的口语中文会永远感激你。

segments.en: I bet you it will even surpass mine with all that practice.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌，经过这么多练习，你的中文甚至会超过我的。

segments.en: I highly doubt it.
segments.cn: 我对此深表怀疑。

segments.en: Your girlfriend is Chinese.
segments.cn: 你的女朋友是中国人。

segments.en: Well, there is that, yes.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，确实如此。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now we have more nationalities prepared for you, so let's take a look at those now on Language Takeaway Part 2.
segments.cn: 现在我们为你准备了更多的国籍，让我们现在在语言收获第二部分看看这些。

segments.en: Language Takeaway We're in Asia for this part of today's lesson, so we're going to start with a country called Pakistan.
segments.cn: 语言收获 我们在亚洲进行今天课程的这一部分，所以我们将从一个叫巴基斯坦的国家开始。

segments.en: What do we call the people from Pakistan?
segments.cn: 我们称来自巴基斯坦的人为？

segments.en: We say they are Pakistani.
segments.cn: 我们说他们是巴基斯坦人。

segments.en: Okay, so in Chicago, for example, there are many Pakistanis.
segments.cn: 好的，比如在芝加哥，有很多巴基斯坦人。

segments.en: Okay, and moving on to Southeast Asia, we have Indonesians.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来是东南亚，我们有印尼人。

segments.en: Alright, Indonesia is the country, and people who come from there are Indonesian.
segments.cn: 好的，印尼是这个国家，来自那里的人是印尼人。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: Now if we go back to the north part of Asia, we have South Koreans.
segments.cn: 现在如果我们回到亚洲北部，我们有韩国人。

segments.en: So we have North and South Korea on our maps.
segments.cn: 所以我们的地图上有北韩和南韩。

segments.en: A person from North Korea is North Korean, and a person from South Korea is South Korean.
segments.cn: 来自北韩的人是北韩人，来自南韩的人是南韩人。

segments.en: It's kind of like that same structure, American, Brazilian, Korean.
segments.cn: 这有点像同样的结构，美国人，巴西人，韩国人。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And moving to the island of Japan, we have Japanese.
segments.cn: 现在转到日本岛，我们有日本人。

segments.en: So this is an adjective, we're talking about a Japanese person, he is Japanese, or we can also talk about the food, like Sushi is Japanese food.
segments.cn: 这是一个形容词，我们在谈论一个日本人，他是日本人，或者我们也可以谈论食物，比如寿司是日本食物。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, moving back to Southeast Asia again, we have Malaysia.
segments.cn: 好的，再次回到东南亚，我们有马来西亚。

segments.en: So people from Malaysia are called Malaysian.
segments.cn: 所以来自马来西亚的人称为马来西亚人。

segments.en: Okay, again with this pattern, Malaysian, Korean.
segments.cn: 好的，再次使用这个模式，马来西亚人，韩国人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And I think you say Malaysian food, or you say Malay.
segments.cn: 我想你说马来西亚菜，或者你说马来。

segments.en: I've heard some people say Malay.
segments.cn: 我听过一些人说马来。

segments.en: I've said Malaysian food generally, but Malay I think is one of the languages, and I think it's an ethnic group as well.
segments.cn: 我通常说马来西亚菜，但我认为马来是其中一种语言，我认为也是一个民族群体。

segments.en: So you can have Malay people in Singapore, for example.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在新加坡有马来人，例如。

segments.en: Okay, and actually we have Thai people and Singaporeans.
segments.cn: 好的，实际上我们还有泰国人和新加坡人。

segments.en: So we have two countries there, Thailand and Singapore.
segments.cn: 所以我们有两个国家，泰国和新加坡。

segments.en: So Thai is the adjective to describe things that come from Thailand.
segments.cn: 泰国是形容词，用来描述来自泰国的事物。

segments.en: It's kind of unusual, it doesn't fit that pattern that I mentioned, but it's a very important one to remember if you like to eat food from this country, Thai food.
segments.cn: 这有点不寻常，不符合我提到的模式，但如果你喜欢吃这个国家的食物，泰国菜，这是一个非常重要的记忆点。

segments.en: Yeah, excellent food.
segments.cn: 是的，绝佳的食物。

segments.en: And Singaporean food is also pretty good, and people from Singapore are also called Singaporean.
segments.cn: 新加坡菜也很好，来自新加坡的人也称为新加坡人。

segments.en: Here we've got a very tricky one.
segments.cn: 这里有一个非常棘手的。

segments.en: We've got the country, the Philippines.
segments.cn: 我们有一个国家，菲律宾。

segments.en: What do you call a person from the Philippines?
segments.cn: 来自菲律宾的人称为？

segments.en: So the Philippines is actually spelled P-H-I, like Philippines, right?
segments.cn: 所以菲律宾的拼写是P-H-I，像菲律宾，对吧？

segments.en: But if somebody is from the Philippines, we say Filipino with an F.
segments.cn: 但如果某人来自菲律宾，我们说他是菲律宾人，F开头。

segments.en: Alright, Filipino.
segments.cn: 好的，菲律宾人。

segments.en: This is interesting, especially for people who are native Spanish speakers because the Philippines was a Spanish colony for a very long time, and so you might hear someone refer to himself as a Filipino, he's a man, or if she is a woman, a Filipina.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，尤其是对于以西班牙语为母语的人，因为菲律宾曾是西班牙的殖民地很长时间，所以你可能会听到有人称自己为菲律宾人，他是男性，或者如果她是女性，则称为菲律宾娜。

segments.en: So this is very similar to the Spanish structure of having a gender on the end of the word.
segments.cn: 这与西班牙的性别结构非常相似。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And well, now we're moving on to Kazakhstan and Russia.
segments.cn: 现在我们转到哈萨克斯坦和俄罗斯。

segments.en: We have people that are from Kazakhstan and Russia, and we say they are Kazakhstani.
segments.cn: 我们有来自哈萨克斯坦和俄罗斯的人，我们称他们为哈萨克斯坦人。

segments.en: So this is very common in that part of the world to end the adjective in an I, like Afghanistan, Afghani, Pakistan, Pakistani, Kazakhstani.
segments.cn: 所以在那个地区，形容词以I结尾是非常常见的，比如阿富汗，阿富汗人，巴基斯坦，巴基斯坦人，哈萨克斯坦，哈萨克斯坦人。

segments.en: And so these are the stands, the former USSR.
segments.cn: 这些都是斯坦，前苏联国家。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So this is a very important structure to remember, but Russia is pretty easy.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常重要的结构要记住，但俄罗斯就简单多了。

segments.en: Yeah, people from Russia, you say they are Russian, or you have Russian food.
segments.cn: 是的，来自俄罗斯的人，你说他们是俄罗斯人，或者你有俄罗斯菜。

segments.en: I love Russian food.
segments.cn: 我爱俄罗斯菜。

segments.en: Alright, so we have a lot of different nationalities there, and obviously we didn't cover all of them.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们有很多不同的国籍，显然我们没有涵盖所有的。

segments.en: I think, I don't know, maybe 200 nationalities.
segments.cn: 我想，我不知道，也许有200个国籍。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back to talk a little bit more about this really interesting topic.
segments.cn: 那么我们再听一遍对话，我们会回来谈谈这个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: Hey, how was your first day of class?
segments.cn: 嘿，你的第一天上课怎么样？

segments.en: I'm on level 2 and I'm loving my class this semester.
segments.cn: 我在二级，我这个学期很喜欢我的课。

segments.en: It's great being in a class of international students.
segments.cn: 在国际学生的班级里真不错。

segments.en: Mine was okay, except that no one in my class speaks English.
segments.cn: 我还好，只是我班上没有人说英语。

segments.en: I guess it will force me to converse in Chinese more in class, so at least I should improve a lot this semester.
segments.cn: 我想这会迫使我在课堂上更多地用中文交流，所以至少我这个学期应该会有很大进步。

segments.en: That's both fortunate and unfortunate.
segments.cn: 这既是幸运也是不幸。

segments.en: It's the United Nations in my class.
segments.cn: 我班上就像联合国。

segments.en: We have people from all over the world.
segments.cn: 我们有来自世界各地的人。

segments.en: There are three Germans, a Pole, a Scott, two French, an American, a Brazilian, a Chilean, a New Zealander, though he prefers to call himself a Kiwi.
segments.cn: 有三个德国人，一个波兰人，一个苏格兰人，两法国人，一个美国人，一个巴西人，一个智利人，一个新西兰人，虽然他更喜欢称自己为基维。

segments.en: Who else do we have?
segments.cn: 还有谁呢？

segments.en: Oh, we have a Moroccan, a Tagolese, a Pakistani, and two Indonesians.
segments.cn: 哦，我们有一个摩洛哥人，一个塔戈人，一个巴基斯坦人和两个印尼人。

segments.en: That's quite the array of nationalities.
segments.cn: 这真是一个多样的国籍阵容。

segments.en: Everyone in my class is from Asia, except me.
segments.cn: 我班上的每个人都来自亚洲，除了我。

segments.en: There are a few South Koreans, several Japanese, Malaysian, Thai, Singaporean, Filipino, Kazakhstani, and one Russian.
segments.cn: 有几个韩国人，几个日本人，马来西亚人，泰国人，新加坡人，菲律宾人，哈萨克斯坦人，还有一个俄罗斯人。

segments.en: Well, I think you're pretty lucky, actually.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得你其实很幸运。

segments.en: You'll have the opportunity to learn so much about Asian culture.
segments.cn: 你将有机会了解很多关于亚洲文化的知识。

segments.en: I guess so.
segments.cn: 我想是的。

segments.en: But I think it's going to be hard to relate to my classmates, especially with the language barrier.
segments.cn: 但我觉得与我的同学交流会很困难，尤其是语言障碍。

segments.en: I think I might change classes.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会换班。

segments.en: Don't!
segments.cn: 不要！

segments.en: Stay the course!
segments.cn: 坚持下去！

segments.en: Your spoken Chinese will be eternally grateful.
segments.cn: 你的口语中文会永远感激你。

segments.en: I bet you it will even surpass mine with all that practice.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌，经过这么多练习，你的中文甚至会超过我的。

segments.en: I highly doubt it.
segments.cn: 我对此表示怀疑。

segments.en: Your girlfriend is Chinese.
segments.cn: 你的女朋友是中国人。

segments.en: Well, there is that, yes.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，确实如此。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So, talking about nationalities, I think there's one that we didn't mention that's very, very popular.
segments.cn: 所以，谈到国籍，我觉得有一个我们没有提到的，非常非常受欢迎。

segments.en: People from Ireland.
segments.cn: 来自爱尔兰的人。

segments.en: Okay, so people from Ireland are called Irish.
segments.cn: 好吧，来自爱尔兰的人叫爱尔兰人。

segments.en: Irish.
segments.cn: 爱尔兰人。

segments.en: The Irish, or Irishmen.
segments.cn: 爱尔兰人，或爱尔兰男性。

segments.en: This is a similar structure to a lot of those countries in Northern Europe, like Sweden and Finland.
segments.cn: 这与北欧许多国家的结构相似，比如瑞典和芬兰。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, somebody from Sweden would be called Swedish.
segments.cn: 所以，来自瑞典的人叫瑞典人。

segments.en: Yes, or a Swede is the noun.
segments.cn: 是的，或者瑞典人是名词。

segments.en: So, I love to eat Swedish food like salmon.
segments.cn: 所以，我喜欢吃瑞典食物，比如三文鱼。

segments.en: But a similar structure applies to Finland.
segments.cn: 但芬兰也适用类似的结构。

segments.en: In Finland, they're very famous for their Finnish bread.
segments.cn: 在芬兰，他们以芬兰面包而闻名。

segments.en: Finnish.
segments.cn: 芬兰的。

segments.en: So, that's the way that you say Finnish, with double N, right?
segments.cn: 所以，这就是你说芬兰的方式，双N，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's not like I finished my homework.
segments.cn: 这不是我完成了我的作业。

segments.en: It's like F-I-N-N-I-S-H.
segments.cn: 这就像F-I-N-N-I-S-H。

segments.en: Finnish.
segments.cn: 芬兰的。

segments.en: Finnish.
segments.cn: 芬兰的。

segments.en: And now, what about people from Denmark?
segments.cn: 那么，来自丹麦的人呢？

segments.en: They are Danish.
segments.cn: 他们是丹麦人。

segments.en: Danish.
segments.cn: 丹麦人。

segments.en: And what about people from Norway?
segments.cn: 那么，来自挪威的人呢？

segments.en: They are Norwegian.
segments.cn: 他们是挪威人。

segments.en: So, that's one that does not fit the pattern.
segments.cn: 所以，这个不符合模式。

segments.en: And this is a very interesting one that also doesn't fit the pattern at all.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的例子，也完全不符合模式。

segments.en: People from Holland.
segments.cn: 来自荷兰的人。

segments.en: Okay, so Holland as a country has two names.
segments.cn: 好吧，荷兰作为一个国家有两个名字。

segments.en: We sometimes say Holland.
segments.cn: 我们有时说荷兰。

segments.en: We sometimes say the Netherlands.
segments.cn: 我们有时说荷兰王国。

segments.en: But a person who comes from Holland is called Dutch.
segments.cn: 但来自荷兰的人叫荷兰人。

segments.en: He is Dutch.
segments.cn: 他是荷兰人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, it doesn't have to do with Holland.
segments.cn: 所以，这与荷兰无关。

segments.en: You don't say a Holander or Netherlands.
segments.cn: 你不会说荷兰人或荷兰。

segments.en: You don't say Netherlander.
segments.cn: 你不会说荷兰人。

segments.en: It's Dutch.
segments.cn: 是荷兰人。

segments.en: Dutch.
segments.cn: 荷兰人。

segments.en: You'll also read this on cookie tins.
segments.cn: 你也会在饼干罐上看到这个。

segments.en: You know boxes for cookies.
segments.cn: 你知道饼干的盒子。

segments.en: Dutch style cookies.
segments.cn: 荷兰风格的饼干。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, so that's a very important one when it comes to food.
segments.cn: 好吧，这在食物方面是一个非常重要的例子。

segments.en: But we're very curious to hear about where you come from.
segments.cn: 但我们非常好奇想听听你来自哪里。

segments.en: You should try some of the new vocabulary words that we have introduced here.
segments.cn: 你应该尝试一些我们在这里介绍的新词汇。

segments.en: Talk about your friends or your family.
segments.cn: 谈谈你的朋友或家人。

segments.en: But also, tell us if we didn't include your nationality.
segments.cn: 但也告诉我们，如果我们没有包括你的国籍。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, so we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: EnglishPod.com Bye!
segments.cn: EnglishPod.com 再见！
